intro: Dehaasia nigrescens, commonly known as the black-stemmed daisies, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in open grasslands and has slender, often hairy stems that turn dark purple or black with age. Its leaves are alternate, lance-shaped, and covered in fine hairs, while its flowers are small and yellow, arranged in clusters. Dehaasia nigrescens is often found in sandy or rocky soils and is adapted to arid conditions.
